Subjective.Chief_Complaint: Neck and back pain following a motor vehicle accident (MVA)
Subjective.History_of_Present_Illness: Patient reports neck and back pain for four weeks duration following a MVA.  Pain has improved with ten physiotherapy sessions.  Currently reports occasional back pain.

Objective.Physical_Exam: Not documented in provided transcript.  Physical exam required to assess range of motion, tenderness, and neurological status.
Objective.Observations: Patient reports improvement in symptoms with physiotherapy.

Assessment.Diagnosis: Likely Cervical and Lumbar Strain/Sprain.  Differential diagnoses include disc herniation, facet joint injury, or other MVA related injuries. Further evaluation required.
Assessment.Severity: Initially severe, currently mild based on patient report.  Objective assessment required for accurate severity determination.

Plan.Treatment: Continue current physiotherapy regimen.  Consider further imaging (X-ray, MRI) if pain persists or worsens.  Possible referral to orthopedics or pain management if indicated.  Patient education regarding proper posture and body mechanics.
Plan.Follow-Up: Schedule follow-up appointment in 2-4 weeks to reassess symptoms and response to treatment.
